qas.question: Who designed the Roland Levinsky building?
When did the Roland Levinsky building open?
Of what university is the Roland Levinsky building a part?
What academic discipline at the university is based in the Roland Levinsky building?
What part of Plymouth is the Roland Levinsky building situated in?

context: The Roland Levinsky building, the landmark building of the <a2_0>University of Plymouth<a2_0/>, is located in <a4_0>the city's central quarter<a4_0/>. Designed by leading architect <a0_0>Henning Larsen<a0_0/>, the building was opened in <a1_0>2008<a1_0/> and houses the University's <a3_0>Arts<a3_0/> faculty. It has been consistently considered one of the UK's most beautiful university buildings.
